newsitem.title: USA: N.J. vote on $636 mln rail link on hold - paper.
newsitem.headline: N.J. vote on $636 mln rail link on hold - paper.

text.p: New Jersey transportation officials postponed voting on a $636 million light-rail link between Newark and Elizabeth after a proposal would have focused initial work only in Newark, the Star Ledger reported Wednesday.

Uncoupling the southern eight miles and concentrating just on the northern segment connecting Newark's Penn Station to Broad Street would be a "death sentence" for the prject, according to officials involved in the project, the newspaper said.
New Jersey Transit staff proposed the split development idea, and the ensuing criticism prompted the state to postpone a board vote on the entire project.
